description: From *nift +‎ -y. First element is of unknown origin. Possibly theatrical slang, as a shortened, altered form of Magnificat.

entries.meaning: (colloquial, somewhat dated) Good, smart; useful or beneficial.
examples: a nifty trick for reducing your household energy bill
You look nifty in that jacket.

entries.meaning: (colloquial, dated) A possibly risqué comic story or anecdote.
examples: New subscribers are the life of our party (any advertiser will tell you that) just as the regular reader of CLIPPINGS becomes the life of any party (and why not with such a supply of “nifties” and bon mots).
